Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_629909: How can I copy lines from a file every 60 seconds, and continue from last copied
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_629909: #! /bin/sh -

while true; do
  head -n 10000 > output.txt
  sleep 60
done < input.yml

#! /bin/sh -

while true; do
  head -n 10000
  sleep 60
done < input.yml > output.txt

Explanations about Options.-n:
print the first NUM lines instead of the first 10; with the leading '-', print all
 but the last NUM lines of each file
